item.title: Mayor talks progress in tour of Bradenton’s wastewater plant
item.description: Bradenton mayor Gene Brown said in an interview that they are working hard to get to a point where they don’t have to bypass any water.

item.title: Suspected car thief arrested in Tampa
item.description: Suspected car thief arrested in Tampa

item.title: Mostly Sunny and Dry
item.description: Rain chances are also low with drier air in the upper atmosphere

item.title: Shorter days and low rain chances
item.description: Rain chances are low with drier air in the upper atmosphere

item.title: Letter written by flight attendant who died in 9/11 attacks makes it to her son 24 years later
item.description: A Florida man received a special letter in the mail from his mother, who died in the 9/11 terrorist attacks.

item.title: ‘I am going to cook you all’: Police say school bus driver blasted heat to punish students
item.description: A Pennsylvania school bus driver is facing criminal charges for allegedly threatening the children onboard.

item.title: Video captures driver going through railroad crossing gate before being struck in deadly collision
item.description: Newly-released video shows the moment a driver went around crossing arms and straight into the path of a train.

item.title: Iran withdraws resolution banning attacks on nuclear sites following US pressure
item.description: Iran decided at the last minute Thursday to withdraw a resolution prohibiting attacks on nuclear facilities.

item.title: Members of Congress take steps to tighten their own security after Kirk’s killing
item.description: Members of Congress are taking steps to tighten their own security as the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk has deeply shaken lawmakers who were already concerned for their safety.

item.title: 16-year-old kills gunman in deadly Clay County home invasion
item.description: Detectives found no link between the victims of a deadly home invasion shooting in Clay County and the gunman

item.title: FHP: 2 teens killed, 1 deputy and others injured in patrol car crash in Lafayette County
item.description: Two teenagers were killed and others were injured, including a Lafayette County Sheriff deputy, after a crash between a patrol car and a sedan, per the Florida Highway Patrol.

item.title: 63-year-old man hit, killed in Nokomis crash
item.description: The 63-year-old man was pronounced dead on the scene.
